page.title: 11I REMEMBER, (CONT'D)
page.content: MOTHER BECAUSE THEY WERE VERY POOR AND BEING ABLE TO GET THE MILK WITHOUT PAYING HELPED. MR.JOHNSON REMEMBERED HELPING OUT ON THE STALLS ON THE CATTLE MARKET. HE USED TO LOOK AFTER A STALL WHILE THE OWNER WENT TO THE PUBLIC HOUSE FOR HIS DINNER. THE PUBLIC HOUSES IN LEEK USED TO STAY OPEN ALL DAY ON WEDNESDAY AND EVEN TODAY SOME PUBS STILL STAY OPEN BECAUSE WEDNESDAY IS STILL MARKET DAY. MR.JOHNSON REMEMBERED HIS SCHOOLDAYS WHICH HE SAID WERE A LOT DIFFERENT FROM OUR SCHOOLDAYS. HE TOLD US ABOUT ONE OF THE TEACHERS WHO USED TO HIT THE CHILDREN ON THE HEAD IF THEY DIDN'T ANSWER THE QUESTIONS CORRECTLY.HE ALSO REMEMBERS SOME OF THE CHILDREN ATTENDING SCHOOL PART-TIME.THAT IS GOING IN TO SCHOOL IN THE MORNING AND WORKING IN THE MILLS IN THE AFTERNOON. SCHOOLS HAVE CHANGED!
